name: Introduction to Health and Society
description: Same as Sociology 308S. A broad, multidisciplinary overview that introduces students to the study of health and society. Three lecture hours a week for one semester. Only one of the following may be counted: Health and Society 301, Sociology 308 (Topic: Introduction to Health and Society), 308S.

name: Health Care Policy in the United States
description: An overview of the health care system in the United States and analysis of health policy issues primarily from the perspective of health economics. Three lecture hours a week for one semester. Prerequisite: Upper-division standing.

name: Advanced Research in Health and Society
description: Three lecture hours a week for one semester. Prerequisite: Upper-division standing; Health and Society 301 with a grade of at least B- and one of the following with a grade of at least B-: Biology 318M, Educational Psychology 371, Geography 310C, Sociology 317L, Statistics and Data Sciences 302, 304, 318, (or Statistics and Scientific Computation 302, 304, 318), Social Work 318.

name: Seminar in Health and Society
description: Focuses on a key topic or debate within the Health and Society area of study and develops students' abilities to use data and write a research or policy paper that informs that topic or debate. Three lecture hours a week for one semester. Prerequisite: Upper-division standing and Health and Society 301.

name: Honors Tutorial Course
description: A supervised conference course to provide training in research and writing. The equivalent of three lecture hours a week for two semesters.  Offered on the letter-grade basis only. Prerequisite: For 679HA, upper-division standing and admission to the honors program in Health and Society; for 679HB, Health and Society 679HA.
